marklogic.body:
Most people have only the foggiest idea of what happened. They need to gather the facts before they comment:
It was a dark and stormy night. A six foot seventeen year old went out in it walking to a local 7-11 for a bag of skittles and an iced tea. The neighborhood watchman headed out to the grocery in his SUV when he Spotted the boy returning to the home of his father's fiancee that they were visiting that night in a "gated" community where the gates were open and anyone could enter.
It almost sounds like the beginning of a novel.
The watchman saw the boy Acting strangely, aimlessly looking at different houses and wondered what the boy was up to. Parking the SUV he picked up his pistol in its holster and shoving it into his waistband got out of the vehicle and started walking toward the boy who continued in his strange activity. Taking out his cellphone, the watchman called police....
Now come on people, get the rest of the story correctly. Geez.
